q7.description:
$G = (\{S\}, \{a,b\}, S, P)$
$S \rightarrow aSb | ab$
Derivation of $aaabbb$:
$S \Rightarrow aSb \Rightarrow aaSbb \Rightarrow aaabbb$
q7.question: What do we mean by Derivation of string $aaabbb$?
q7.answer: Starting  at the start variable of the grammar and do replacements until we reach the string $aaabbb$.
choices: Starting  at the start variable of the grammar and do replacements until we reach the string $aaabbb$.

q8.description:
$G = (\{S\}, \{a,b\}, S, P)$
$S \rightarrow aSb | ab$
Derivation of $aaabbb$:
$S \Rightarrow aSb \Rightarrow aaSbb \Rightarrow aaabbb$. In every step in the derivation process we get what is called $\textbf{'Sentential form'}$
q8.question: Based on the derivation of the sting $aaabbb$, select all sentential forms?

q20.description:
Let us see this Grammar $G$ =($\{S,A,B\}$,$\{a,b,c\}$,S,P)
$S\rightarrow AcB$
$A\rightarrow aAa$ | $\lambda$
$B\rightarrow Bbb$ | $\lambda$
q20.question: What is this grammar type?
q20.answer: Context-Free Grammar even if it is a Regular Language
choices: Regular Grammar. Because it is a Regular Language
Context-Free Grammar even if it is a Regular Language

q27.description:
$G$ =($\{S,A,B\}$,$\{a,b,c\}$,S,P)
$S\rightarrow AcB$
$A\rightarrow aAa$ | $\lambda$
$B\rightarrow Bbb$ | $\lambda$
$\textbf {Definition}$: Leftmost derivation: in each step of a derivation, replace the leftmost variable.
q27.question: Currently, we have $S \Rightarrow AcB$. Following the Leftmost derivation order, which variable should be replaced?
q27.answer: A as it is the leftmost variable
choices: A as it is the leftmost variable
B as it is the rightmost variable
